com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document

Class SpenNoteDoc

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenNoteDoc

  • public class SpenNoteDoc
extends Object
    NoteDoc class This class provides the functionality for managing the data of an SPD file and provides methods for loading and saving the file, adding and removing PageDocs from NoteDocs, and attaching external files.
    Since:
    3.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
                   int width,
                   int height)
            throws IOException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. If the (width, height) is too large, OutOfMemory problem may occur while using the notedoc.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        width - The PageDoc width in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView width in general.
        height - The PageDoc height in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView height in general.
        Throws:
        IOException - If a cache directory fails to be generated.
        NullPointerException - If the context is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if width or height less than 0.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
                   int orientation,
                   int width,
                   int height)
            throws IOException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified orientation.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. If the (width, height) is too large, OutOfMemory problem may occur while using the notedoc.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        orientation - The orientation mode for the NoteDoc instance. The valid values are: ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE For more information, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        width - The PageDoc width in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView width in general.
        height - The PageDoc height in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView height in general.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory fails to be generated.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the orientation is invalid. Or if width or height less than 0.
        NullPointerException - If the context is null.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
                   String filePath,
                   int width,
                   int mode)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified file and read/write mode.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        width - The PageDoc width in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView width in general. If the width is changed and the user opens a SPD file, the object attributes for the page such as, line width, and border change accordingly. If the width is too large, OutOfMemory problem may occur while using the notedoc.
        mode - SpenNoteDoc mode. If the mode is not MODE_READ_ONLY, the SpenNoteDoc mode is set to MODE_WRITABLE. For more details, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory is not generated or the files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is passed.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - Thrown if the file requires a password.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException - It not correspond to the NoteDoc file format
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown If the filePath is null. Or if width less than 32.
        NullPointerException - Thrown If the context is null.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
                   String filePath,
                   double rotation,
                   int mode)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified rotation, file and read/write mode.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. Use a double for rotation and not an integer to avoid confusion with the width parameter.
        SpenNoteDoc note = new SpenNoteDoc(context, filePath, (double)rotation);
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        rotation - The rotation value for the note, page and objects. Use a double that is divisible by 90.
        mode - The SpenNoteDoc mode. If the mode is not MODE_READ_ONLY, the SpenNoteDoc mode is set to MODE_WRITABLE. For more information, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory is not generated or the files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is detected.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - Thrown if the file requires a password.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException - It not correspond to the NoteDoc file format
        IllegalArgumentException - If the rotation parameter is not a double that is divisible by 90 or the filePath is null.
        NullPointerException - If the context is null.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
                   String filePath,
                   String password,
                   int width,
                   int mode)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified file, password, and read/write mode.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        password - The password for a protected file.
        width - The PageDoc width in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView width in general. If the width is changed and the user opens a SPD file, the object attributes for the page such as, line width, and border change accordingly. If the width is too large, OutOfMemory problem may occur while using the notedoc.
        mode - The mode for SpenNoteDoc. If the mode is not MODE_READ_ONLY, the SpenNoteDoc mode is set to MODE_WRITABLE. For more details, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory is not generated or the files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is detected.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - Thrown if the password passed is invalid.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException - It not correspond to the NoteDoc file format
        IllegalArgumentException - If the filePath is null. Or if width less than 32.
        NullPointerException - If the context is null.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
                   String filePath,
                   String password,
                   double rotation,
                   int mode)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified file, password, rotation and read/write mode.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. Use a double for rotation and not an integer to avoid confusion with the width parameter.
        SpenNoteDoc note = new SpenNoteDoc(context, filePath, password, (double)rotation);
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        password - The password for a protected file.
        rotation - The rotation for the note, page and objects. Use a double type that is divisible by 90.
        mode - The SpenNoteDoc mode. If the mode is not MODE_READ_ONLY,the SpenNoteDoc mode is set to MODE_WRITABLE. For more details, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory is not generated or the files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is detected.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - Thrown if the password passed is invalid.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException - It not correspond to the NoteDoc file format
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the rotation parameter is not a double that is divisible by 90 or the filePath is null.
        NullPointerException - Thrown if the context is null.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
                   String filePath,
                   int width,
                   int mode,
                   boolean discardUnsavedData)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified file, read/write mode and cache handling mode.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        width - The PageDoc width in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView width in general. If the width is changed and the user opens a SPD file, the object attributes for the page such as, line width, and border change accordingly. If the width is too large, OutOfMemory problem may occur while using the notedoc.
        mode - The mode for SpenNoteDoc. If the mode is not MODE_READ_ONLY, the SpenNoteDoc mode is set to MODE_WRITABLE. For more details, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        discardUnsavedData - Set to true to ignore the files in the internal cache directory and use new files, set to false to use the files in the internal cache directory.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory is not generated or the files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is detected.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException - It not correspond to the NoteDoc file format
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - If a file requires a password.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the filePath is null. Or if width less than 32.
        NullPointerException - If the context is null.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
                   String filePath,
                   String password,
                   int width,
                   int mode,
                   boolean discardUnsavedData)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified file, password, read/write mode and cache handling mode.
        To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        password - The password for a protected file.
        width - The PageDoc width in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView width in general. If the width is changed and the user opens a SPD file, the object attributes for the page such as, line width, and border change accordingly. If the width is too large, OutOfMemory problem may occur while using the notedoc.
        mode - The SpenNoteDoc mode. If the mode is not MODE_READ_ONLY, the SpenNoteDoc mode is set to MODE_WRITABLE. For more details, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        discardUnsavedData - Set to true to ignore the files in the internal cache directory and use new files, set to false to use the files in the internal cache directory.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the cache directory is not generated or its files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - If an unsupported file format is detected.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - If the password is invalid.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException - It not correspond to the NoteDoc file format
        IllegalArgumentException - If the filePath is null. Or if width less than 32.
        NullPointerException - If the context is null .
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
                   String filePath,
                   double rotation,
                   int mode,
                   ArrayList<SpenObjectBase> signature)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified file, rotation, read/write mode and signature.
        This method works for a file which is locked by signature only. So, if the file isn't locked or is locked by normal password, this method will not work. To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. Use a double for rotation and not an integer to avoid confusion with the width parameter.
        SpenNoteDoc note = new SpenNoteDoc(context, filePath, password, (double)rotation);
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        rotation - The rotation for the note, page and objects. Use a double type that is divisible by 90.
        mode - The SpenNoteDoc mode. If the mode is not MODE_READ_ONLY,the SpenNoteDoc mode is set to MODE_WRITABLE. For more details, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        signature - The signature for a protected file.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory is not generated or the files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is detected.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - Thrown if the signature is not matched or the file isn't locked by signature.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException - It not correspond to the NoteDoc file format
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the rotation parameter is not a double that is divisible by 90. Or, the filePath is null.
        Thrown if signature is null or has any object which is not an SpenObjectStroke. Or, if an SpenObjectStroke doens't have orientations or tilts information.
        NullPointerException - Thrown if the context is null.
        Since:
        4.0.0
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

      • SpenNoteDoc

        public SpenNoteDoc(Context context,
                   String filePath,
                   int width,
                   int mode,
                   boolean discardUnsavedData,
                   ArrayList<SpenObjectBase> signature)
            throws IOException,
                   SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                   SpenInvalidPasswordException,
                   SpenUnsupportedVersionException
        Creates an SpenNoteDoc instance with the specified file, read/write mode, cache handling mode and signature.
        This method works for a file which is locked by signature only. So, if the file isn't locked or is locked by normal password, this method will not work. To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context for your application.
        filePath - The absolute path of the files that you want to load.
        width - The PageDoc width in pixels. For a NoteDoc, this parameter should match the CanvasView width in general. If the width is changed and the user opens a SPD file, the object attributes for the page such as, line width, and border change accordingly. If the width is too large, OutOfMemory problem may occur while using the notedoc.
        mode - The SpenNoteDoc mode. If the mode is not MODE_READ_ONLY, the SpenNoteDoc mode is set to MODE_WRITABLE. For more details, see Field Detail in this class reference.
        discardUnsavedData - Set to true to ignore the files in the internal cache directory and use new files, set to false to use the files in the internal cache directory.
        signature - The signature for a protected file.
        Throws:
        IOException - If the cache directory is not generated or its files are not found.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - If an unsupported file format is detected.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - Thrown if the signature is not matched or the file isn't locked by signature.
        SpenUnsupportedVersionException - It not correspond to the NoteDoc file format
        IllegalArgumentException - If the filePath is null. Or if width less than 32.
        Thrown if signature is null or has any object which is not an SpenObjectStroke. Or, if an SpenObjectStroke doens't have orientations or tilts information.
        NullPointerException - If the context is null .
        Since:
        4.0.0
        See Also:
        close(), discard()

    • Method Detail

      • discard

        public void discard()
             throws IOException
        Discard the NoteDoc instance.
        This method deletes the new data before closing the NoteDoc. To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. A page cannot be called when it is set (setPageDoc) on CanvasView. Initialize the page with setPageDoc(null) before calling it. Close controls before calling a page. You cannot call a page with controls displayed.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory or its files cannot be deleted.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        close()

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Close the note document.
        This method deletes all the data of a NoteDoc before closing it. To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. A page cannot be called when it is set (setPageDoc) on CanvasView. Initialize the page with setPageDoc(null) before calling it. Close controls before calling a page. You cannot call a page with controls displayed.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory or its files cannot be deleted.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        discard()

      • close

        public void close(boolean removeCache)
           throws IOException
        Close the note document.
        This method deletes all the data of a NoteDoc before closing it. To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. A page cannot be called when it is set (setPageDoc) on CanvasView. Initialize the page with setPageDoc(null) before calling it. Close controls before calling a page. You cannot call a page with controls displayed.
        Parameters:
        removeCache - Set to true to remove the cache directory of this note, set to false to not remove the cache directory. If you set true, it cause some latency when you open the note file(.spd) again later. Since the all cache files for this note are removed and all cache files need to be re-created.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory or its files cannot be deleted.
        Since:
        3.0.100
        See Also:
        discard(), close()

      • close

        public void close(boolean removeCache,
                  boolean updateCacheState)
           throws IOException
        Close the note document.
        This method deletes all the data of a NoteDoc before closing it. To close a note, call close() or discard(). If you use the subordinate classes of a NoteDoc instance after closing it by calling discard(), an exception is thrown. A page cannot be called when it is set (setPageDoc) on CanvasView. Initialize the page with setPageDoc(null) before calling it. Close controls before calling a page. You cannot call a page with controls displayed.
        Parameters:
        removeCache - Set to true to remove the cache directory of this note, set to false to not remove the cache directory. If you set true, it cause some latency when you open the note file(.spd) again later. Since the all cache files for this note are removed and all cache files need to be re-created.
        updateCacheState - Set to true to update cache state, set to false to not update cache state.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the cache directory or its files cannot be deleted.
        Since:
        3.0.100
        See Also:
        discard(), close()

      • appendPage

        public SpenPageDoc appendPage(int backgroundColor,
                              String backgroundImagePath,
                              int backgourndImageMode)
        Add a new page with the specified background color and background image.
        Parameters:
        backgroundColor - The background color for the page.
        backgroundImagePath - The absolute path of the background image file.
        backgourndImageMode - The background image mode for the page. The valid value is: SpenPageDoc.BACKGROUND_IMAGE_MODE_CENTER, SpenPageDoc.BACKGROUND_IMAGE_MODE_FIT, SpenPageDoc.BACKGROUND_IMAGE_MODE_STRETCH, SpenPageDoc.BACKGROUND_IMAGE_MODE_TILE For more information, see Field Detail in the SpenPageDoc class reference.
        Returns:
        The PageDoc instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the backgroundImagePath or the backgourndImageMode is invalid.
        Since:
        3.0.0
        See Also:
        SpenPageDoc.BACKGROUND_IMAGE_MODE_CENTER, SpenPageDoc.BACKGROUND_IMAGE_MODE_FIT, SpenPageDoc.BACKGROUND_IMAGE_MODE_STRETCH, SpenPageDoc.BACKGROUND_IMAGE_MODE_TILE

      • appendPage

        public SpenPageDoc appendPage(int width,
                              int height)
        Add a new page of the specified size.
        If the size of pagedoc is too big, OutOfMemory problem may occur. The pagedoc is resized based on the size of notedoc. The width of pagedoc is equal with the width of notedoc.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the page to add
        height - The height of the page to add
        Returns:
        The PageDoc instance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the width or height of the PageDoc is invalid.
        IllegalArgumentException - If width or height is negative.

                              int height)

      • appendTemplatePage

        public SpenPageDoc appendTemplatePage(String templatePath)
                               throws IOException,
                                      SpenUnsupportedTypeException
        Add the specified template.
        Use either the file path or the asset URI for templatePath. If the orientation of the template page does not match the NoteDoc, it is not appended.
        Parameters:
        templatePath - The absolute path of the template file or the Android asset URI of the template. Use either the absolute path of the file or the asset URI for templatePath.
        Returns:
        The PageDoc instance.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the directory of the file or the asset URI does not exist.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is detected.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the template orientation does not match the NoteDoc orientation.
        NullPointerException - Thrown if the templatePath is null.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • insertTemplatePage

        public SpenPageDoc insertTemplatePage(int pageIndex,
                                      String templatePath)
                               throws IOException,
                                      SpenUnsupportedTypeException
        Insert the specified template page at the specified index.
        If the orientation of the template page does not match the NoteDoc, it is not appended.
        Parameters:
        pageIndex - The page index.
        templatePath - The absolute path of the template file or the Android asset URI of the template. Use either the absolute path of the file or the asset URI for templatePath.
        Returns:
        The PageDoc instance.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the directory of the file or the asset URI does not exist.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is detected.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the template orientation does not match the NoteDoc orientation.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the pageIndex passed is out of range.
        NullPointerException - Thrown if the templatePath is null.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • movePageIndex

        public void movePageIndex(SpenPageDoc page,
                          int step)
        Move the index of the specified page by the specified step.
        Moves the page forward or backward by the step. If page index is 3 and the step is 2, the page moves to page 5. If the step is -1, it moves to page 2.
        Parameters:
        page - The page to be moved.
        step - The number of pages to move forward or backward.
        If page index is 3 and the step is 2, the page moves to page 5. If the step is -1, it moves to page 2.
        If the step is negative, the page is moved to the first.
        If the step is larger than index, the page is moved to the last.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the page passed is null.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • save

        public void save(OutputStream stream)
          throws IOException
        Deprecated. As of 4.0.0, replaced by save(OutputStream, boolean).
        Save the note data to the specified stream.
        NOTICE. As of 4.0.0, use the save(OutputStream, boolean).
        If you use this API, it should save with compatible mode of save(OutputStream, boolean).
        Parameters:
        stream - The OutputStream that you want to save to. Use either ByteArrayInputStream or FileInputStream.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the data cannot be saved to the stream.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if stream is not ByteArrayOutputStream or FileOutputStream.
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if the document is read only mode.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • save

        public void save(String filepath)
          throws IOException
        Deprecated. As of 4.0.0, replaced by save(String, boolean).
        Save the note data to a file.
        NOTICE. As of 4.0.0, use the save(String, boolean).
        If you use this API, it should save with compatible mode of save(String, boolean).
        Parameters:
        filepath - The absolute path of the file.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the file is not saved successfully.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the filepath is invalid.
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if the document is read only mode.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • attachToFile

        public void attachToFile(String filePath)
                  throws IOException
        Deprecated. As of 4.0.0, replaced by attachToFile(String, boolean).
        Save all data and attach the saved data to given file.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The absolute path of the file.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the file is not saved successfully.
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if the document is read only mode.
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • save

        public void save(OutputStream stream,
                 boolean compatibleMode)
          throws IOException
        Save the note data to the specified stream with compatibleMode option.

        S Pen SDK 4.0 has a big change. The ObjectShape is supported since version 4.0. And, the ObjectImage and ObjectTextbox have some internal changes. So, some data for S Pen SDK 4.0 will not work properly in S Pen SDK 3.x.
        If you save the note data with compatibleMode, the output data will work for S Pen SDK 3.x. But, the ObjectShape saves as an ObjectImage and some data will be changed and lost to support S Pen SDK 3.x. And, of course, this process makes some latency and overhead.
        If you save the note data without compatibleMode, the output data can not work for S Pen SDK 3.x properly. It doesn't mean that the output data never work for S Pen SDK 3.x. It depend on the internal data of this NoteDoc instance. For example, if this NoteDoc has ObjectStrokes only, the output data will work properly for S Pen SDK 3.x.
        Parameters:
        stream - The OutputStream that you want to save to. Use either ByteArrayInputStream or FileInputStream.
        compatibleMode - Set to true to save this note for which is compatible with S Pen SDK 3.x, set to false to save this note for which is used for S Pen SDK 4.0 or later.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the data cannot be saved to the stream.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if stream is not ByteArrayOutputStream or FileOutputStream.
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if the document is read only mode.
        Since:
        4.0.0

      • save

        public void save(String filepath,
                 boolean compatibleMode)
          throws IOException
        Save the note data to a file with compatibleMode option.

        S Pen SDK 4.0 has a big change. The ObjectShape is supported since version 4.0. And, the ObjectImage and ObjectTextbox have some internal changes. So, some data for S Pen SDK 4.0 will not work properly in S Pen SDK 3.x.
        If you save the note data with compatibleMode, the output file will work for S Pen SDK 3.x. But, the ObjectShape saves as an ObjectImage and some data will be changed and lost to support S Pen SDK 3.x. And, of course, this process makes some latency and overhead.
        If you save the note data without compatibleMode, the output file can not work for S Pen SDK 3.x properly. It doesn't mean that the output data never work for S Pen SDK 3.x. It depend on the internal data of this NoteDoc instance. For example, if this NoteDoc has ObjectStrokes only, the output file will work properly for S Pen SDK 3.x.
        Parameters:
        filepath - The absolute path of the file.
        compatibleMode - Set to true to save this note for which is compatible with S Pen SDK 3.x, set to false to save this note for which is used for S Pen SDK 4.0 or later.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the file is not saved successfully.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the filepath is invalid.
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if the document is read only mode.
        Since:
        4.0.0

      • attachToFile

        public void attachToFile(String filePath,
                         boolean compatibleMode)
                  throws IOException
        Save all data and attach the saved data to given file with compatibleMode option.

        S Pen SDK 4.0 has a big change. The ObjectShape is supported since version 4.0. And, the ObjectImage and ObjectTextbox have some internal changes. So, some data for S Pen SDK 4.0 will not work properly in S Pen SDK 3.x.
        If you save the note data with compatibleMode, the output file will work for S Pen SDK 3.x. But, the ObjectShape saves as an ObjectImage and some data will be changed and lost to support S Pen SDK 3.x. And, of course, this process makes some latency and overhead.
        If you save the note data without compatibleMode, the output file can not work for S Pen SDK 3.x properly. It doesn't mean that the output data never work for S Pen SDK 3.x. It depend on the internal data of this NoteDoc instance. For example, if this NoteDoc has ObjectStrokes only, the output file will work properly for S Pen SDK 3.x.

        Throws:

      • attachTemplatePage

        public void attachTemplatePage(String templateName,
                               String templatePath,
                               int pageIndex)
                        throws IOException,
                               SpenUnsupportedTypeException,
                               SpenInvalidPasswordException
        Attach the specified template page with the specified template name.
        Parameters:
        templateName - The name of template page.
        templatePath - The absolute path of the template file.
        pageIndex - The page index at the original template.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if the directory of the file does not exist.
        SpenUnsupportedTypeException - Thrown if an unsupported file format is detected.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the template orientation does not match the NoteDoc orientation. Or, if the pageIndex or tempateName or templatePath is invalid.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the pageIndex is equals or greater than number of pages in NoteDoc. Or, if pageIndex is less than 0.
        SpenInvalidPasswordException - Thrown if the template page is locked.
        Since:
        3.1.0
        See Also:
        detachTemplatePage(String)

      • getTemplatePageCount

        public int getTemplatePageCount()
        Get the number of template pages in the note.
        Returns:
        The number of template pages.
        Since:
        3.1.0

      • getTemplatePageName

        public String getTemplatePageName(int templateIndex)
        Get the name of the template page with the specified index.
        Parameters:
        templateIndex - Index of template
        Returns:
        The name of template page
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if templateIndex is less than 0. Or, if templateIndex is greater or equals total template pages.
        Since:
        3.1.0

      • insertPages

        public SpenPageDoc insertPages(String templateName,
                               int pageIndex,
                               int count)
        Insert new pages from template page at the index.
        Parameters:
        templateName - The name of template page.
        pageIndex - The page index.
        count - The number of pages to add
        Returns:
        The first added PageDoc instance.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if templatePage is null. Or, if its orientation is not the same with NoteDoc orientation.
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if number of template page of NoteDoc is 0.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if pageIndex is greater than number of page in NoteDoc. Or, if pageIndex is less than 0.
        Since:
        3.1.0

      • copyPage

        public SpenPageDoc copyPage(SpenPageDoc sourcePage,
                            int pageIndex)
        Insert a new page at the index without save. After that, copy the objects from the page document.
        After copy, the history stack is cleared.
        The objects on the pasted page are resized on the target page. If the width of the pasted page is 720 and that of the target page is 1080, all the objects including rect, point, margin, line spacing, border width, font size and pen size are resized by 150%.
        Parameters:
        sourcePage - The page source.
        pageIndex - The page index.
        Returns:
        The PageDoc instance.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the index passed is out of range.
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if sourcePage is null. Thrown if the orientation of the source page is not the same as the orientation of the target page and the size of source page is not the same as the size of the target page.
        Since:
        3.1.0

      • reviseObjectList

        public void reviseObjectList(ArrayList<SpenObjectBase> objectList)
        Change the uri of all ObjectImage instance in objectList to the cache of current NoteDoc.
        Parameters:
        objectList -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if objectList is NULL or no elements.
        Since:
        3.1.0
